intro: Trixis antimenorrhoea var. cladoptera, commonly known as the desert fanflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its broad, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its unique adaptations make it well-suited for survival in extreme desert conditions.
